Key Match Events: The Warriors walked in for points that you would have called embarrassing if the plays had happened once or twice.
Caleb Martin completely lost his man and stood flat-footed as Curry whipped a pass for an open layup.
Maxey shot when he should have passed, passed when he should have shot, and so on.
Pre-Game Insights: Experts favored the Lakers to win based on their recent performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Embiid deserves to be held accountable for his lack of effort in transition defense.
The problem, then, is in Philadelphia’s approach to this season.
Either you are gearing up to compete with the big boys, or you’re not.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Sixers decided they’d had enough of playing basketball on the West Coast and unloaded a steaming pile of horse dung in San Francisco, falling 139-105 to the Warriors at the end of a grotesque performance.
This was largely a good outing from Embiid.
They continue to stick to the ballyhooed Plan that stops Embiid from playing in back-to-backs and congested parts of the schedule.
Others: The Sixers are splitting the baby right now.
They are still selling the idea that they are doing things with the playoffs in mind, while remaining outside of the playoff picture with plenty of hurdles ahead.
